net.zer0bandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.content

Class SQLiteHouseSignalAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zer0bandwidth.android.lib.database.sqlitehouse.content.SQLiteHouseSignalAPI
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SQLiteHouseKeeper.DefaultSignals

    public abstract class SQLiteHouseSignalAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the contract of signals between implementations of SQLiteHouseKeeper and SQLiteHouseRelay.
    Since:
    zer0bandwidth-net/android 0.1.7 (#50)

      Action suffix when sending a result set to a relay.

    • Method Detail

      • getIntentDomain

        protected abstract java.lang.String getIntentDomain()
        Reveals the "domain" under which the keeper and relay will operate. This string forms the root segments of the Intent action tokens.
        Returns:
        the domain linking a keeper and relay

      • getKeeperActions

        public final java.lang.String[] getKeeperActions()
        Accesses the set of keeper actions which will be registered. By default, this is the value of KEEPER_ACTIONS. If the SQLiteHouseKeeper implementation also supports custom actions, then they should be registered with setKeeperActions(java.lang.String[]), which will append the custom list to the default.
        Returns:
        the list of actions supported by the keeper implementation

      • setKeeperActions

        public final SQLiteHouseSignalAPI setKeeperActions(java.lang.String[] asCustomActions)
        Adds a list of custom actions which are expected from a SQLiteHouseKeeper implementation.
        Parameters:
        asCustomActions - the list of custom actions
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • getKeeperActionFormat

        public final java.lang.String getKeeperActionFormat()
        Accesses the format string used to construct keeper actions.
        Returns:
        the format for keeper actions

      • setKeeperActionFormat

        public final SQLiteHouseSignalAPI setKeeperActionFormat(java.lang.String sFormat)
        Sets the format string used to construct actions for Intents that are dispatched to SQLiteHouseKeepers. This format string must have two string variables. Defaults to DEFAULT_KEEPER_ACTION_FORMAT if a null or empty value is supplied.
        Parameters:
        sFormat - the format string
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • getFormattedKeeperAction

        public final java.lang.String getFormattedKeeperAction(java.lang.String sToken)
        Creates a fully-formed action name for the keeper.
        Parameters:
        sToken - the action token (suffix) to be appended
        Returns:
        an action token to be broadcast to a keeper

      • getTokenFromKeeperAction

        public java.lang.String getTokenFromKeeperAction(java.lang.String sAction)
        Extracts the action token from a fully-formatted keeper action string. The default implementation takes the substring after the last period.
        Parameters:
        sAction - the fully-formatted keeper action
        Returns:
        the action token

      • getKeeperIntentFilter

        public final android.content.IntentFilter getKeeperIntentFilter()
        Constructs the IntentFilter for the SQLiteHouseKeeper implementation.
        Returns:
        an intent filter for the keeper

      • getRelayActions

        public final java.lang.String[] getRelayActions()
        Accesses the set of relay actions which will be registered. By default, this is the value of RELAY_ACTIONS. If the SQLiteHouseRelay implementation also supports custom actions, then they should be registered with setRelayActions(java.lang.String[]), which will append the custom list to the default.
        Returns:
        the list of actions supported by the relay implementation

      • setExtraTagFormat

        public final SQLiteHouseSignalAPI setExtraTagFormat(java.lang.String sFormat)
        Sets the format string used to construct tags for Intent extras that are exchanged between the keeper and the relay. Defaults to DEFAULT_EXTRA_TAG_FORMAT if a null or empty value is supplied.
        Parameters:
        sFormat - the format string
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • getFormattedExtraTag

        public final java.lang.String getFormattedExtraTag(java.lang.String sToken)
        Constructs the full name tag for an Intent extra to be exchanged between a keeper and a relay.
        Parameters:
        sToken - the significant part of the extra token which makes it unique among the extras in this API
        Returns:
        the fully-formed extra tag

      • getExtraSchemaClassName

        public java.lang.String getExtraSchemaClassName(android.content.Intent sig)
        Shorthand to retrieve the schematic class name, which is used by almost every keeper and relay function.
        Parameters:
        sig - the intent
        Returns:
        the schematic class name as given in the intent

      • getClassFromExtra

        public <SC extends SQLightable> java.lang.Class<SC> getClassFromExtra(android.content.Intent sig)
                                                               throws IntrospectionException,
                                                                      SQLiteContentException
        Discovers and returns the schematic class definition that is named in an intent sent from a relay to a keeper.
        Type Parameters:
        SC - the schematic class
        Parameters:
        sig - the intent
        Returns:
        the schematic class definition
        Throws:
        SQLiteContentException - if the intent is malformed, in that the class name extra cannot be found or is empty
        IntrospectionException - if something goes wrong while discovering the class definition
        SQLiteContentException - if the extra that's supposed to have the class name in it can't be found

      • getDataFromBundle

        public <SC extends SQLightable> SC getDataFromBundle(android.content.Intent sig,
                                                     java.lang.Class<SC> cls)
                                              throws SQLiteContentException,
                                                     IntrospectionException,
                                                     SchematicException
        Discovers and extracts an instance of a schematic class from an extra provided in an intent from a relay to a keeper.
        Type Parameters:
        SC - the schematic class
        Parameters:
        sig - the intent
        cls - the schematic class
        Returns:
        an instance of the schematic class, with data from the intent
        Throws:
        SQLiteContentException - if the intent is malformed, in that the data extra cannot be found or is empty
        IntrospectionException - if an instance of the schematic class can't be constructed
        SchematicException - if a problem occurs while processing the schematic class

      • reflect

        protected <SC extends SQLightable> SQLightable.Reflection<SC> reflect(java.lang.Class<SC> cls)
        Uses a cached SQLightable.Reflection if available; otherwise, caches a new one, then returns it.
        Type Parameters:
        SC - the schematic class
        Parameters:
        cls - the schematic class
        Returns:
        the class's reflection

      • reflect

        protected <SC extends SQLightable> SQLightable.Reflection<SC> reflect(SC o)
        Uses a cached SQLightable.Reflection if available; otherwise, caches a new one, then returns it.
        Type Parameters:
        SC - the schematic class
        Parameters:
        o - an instance of the schematic class
        Returns:
        the class's reflection
